title: Aussie sheet mask made famous by MAFS' Martha Kalifatidis lands at Adore Beauty
text:
A budding Australian beauty brand that went viral in July after being used by Married At First Sight's Martha Kalifatidis has now landed in a major stockist.

Thanks to Martha and other Aussie celebrities using Aceology's face masks, a handful of products from the brand are now available at Adore Beauty.

In an exclusive statement to Daily Mail Australia, a rep for Aceology said that they were 'so excited that Aceology has been embraced by Aussie beauty lovers.'

Scroll down for video

Popular: The Aussie beauty brand Aceology that went viral in July after being used by Married At First Sight's Martha Kalifatidis on Instagram (pictured) is now stocked in Adore Beauty

They continued: 'We were thrilled to see Australian celebrity make up artist Tobi Henney using it to prep the Victoria's Secret Model Kelsey Merritt's skin last week.'

Other celebrities and influencers that have embraced the brand include WAG Nadia Fairfax, model Natalie Roser, Yan Yan Chan, Bella Thomas, and Sarah Ellen.

'Kate Morris and the team at Adore Beauty have always been the forefront of the latest technology, skincare and giving brands a platform,' Aceology said.

'We're so excited that Aceology has been embraced by Aussie beauty lovers': Australian stars including model Natalie Roser are fans of the brand

'That's why we're so excited to be able to be stocked on there, lined-up with some impressive global players in the skin space.'

Aceology exploded in popularity earlier this year when MAFS star Martha used the brand's Green T Infusion Gel Mask on Instagram.

After posting about the mask to her more than 280,000 followers, the product completely sold-out online within 18 hours.

Claim to fame: Aceology exploded in popularity earlier this year when MAFS star Martha used the brand's Green T Infusion Gel Mask (pictured) on Instagram

The 31-year-old also used the brand's Green T mask and Frosé Infusion mask to prepare her skin for the Logie Awards.

'It's one of my favourites,' she said of the Frosé Infusion mask. 'It instantly plumps up your skin, it's like incredible.'

'I'm a sheet mask professional,' she added. 'It's so cooling and nice.'
description: A budding Australian beauty brand that went viral in July after being used by Married At First Sight's Martha Kalifatidis has now landed in a major stockist.
authors: Jacques Peterson For Daily Mail Australia
